intro: Eranthemum lindaui, commonly known as the velvetleaf eranthemum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Eranthemum lindaui thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded environments.
